articles.content:
Indian President Shows Interest in DPRK's Independent policy and Principle of Self-Reliance 
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Indian President A. P. J. Abdul Kalam showed deep interest in the independent policy and the principle of self-reliance pursued by the Party and the Government of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador e. p. to India Han Chang On on Nov. 30.
 Independence and self-reliance serve as a powerful driver of the development of a state and what is important at present is to strengthen economic cooperation among countries, he noted.

Intensified Crackdown on Government Employees Union in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean security authorities have reportedly intensified crackdown on the Government Employees Union.
 On November 30 the security authorities sent police to walk away participants in the rally for legalization of the Government Employees Union and the three rights of labor held in Youido, Seoul, branding the rally as illegal.    
 Angered by this, unionists and Pak Sok Un, executive chairman of the People's Solidarity for Abolition of the "National Security Law" and members of civic and public organizations who were on the sit-in strike in the vicinity strongly protested against the police crackdown, shouting "Riot police, step back" and other slogans.

articles.content:
Greetings to King of Thailand
    Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Bhumibol Adulyadej, king of Thailand, on December 4 on the occasion of his birthday and the national day.
 The message wholeheartedly wished the king good health and happiness and the friendly Thai people progress and prosperity.

Pak Pong Ju Greets Thai PM
    Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Thaksin Shinawatra, prime minister of Thailand, on the occasion of its national day.
 In the belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, too, the message wished the prime minister a fresh success in the work for progress and prosperity of the country.    
 Meanwhile, Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a similar message to his Thai counterpart Surakiart Sathirathai.
